review.title: Towards Multistage Design of Modular Systems
review.abstract: The paper describes multistage design of composite (modular) systems (i.e., design of a system trajectory). This design process consists of the following: (i) definition of a set of time/logical points; (ii) modular design of the system for each time/logical point (e.g., on the basis of combinatorial synthesis as hierarchical morphological design or multiple choice problem) to obtain several system solutions; (iii) selection of the system solution for each time/logical point while taking into account their quality and the quality of compatibility between neighbor selected system solutions (here, combinatorial synthesis is used as well). Mainly, the examined time/logical points are based on a time chain. In addition, two complicated cases are considered: (a) the examined logical points are based on a tree-like structure, (b) the examined logical points are based on a digraph. Numerical examples illustrate the approach.

sections.text: The paper describes multi-level design of the system for each time / logical point (e.g. based on a combinatorial synthesis as a hierarchical morphological design or multiple-choice problem).This design process consists of: (i) defining a set of time / logical points; (iii) selecting the system solution for each time / logical point taking into account its quality and the quality of compatibility between selected system solutions (here combinatorial synthesis is used as a morphological design or multiple-choice problem) in order to obtain multiple system solutions; (iii) selecting the system solution for each time / logical point while maintaining the quality of compatibility between adjacent selected system solutions (here combinatorial synthesis is also used).Essentially, the time / logical points studied are based on a time chain.
